title: Training Simulation for Student-Centered Language-Integrated Mathematics Textbook Design for 8th Grade: Strengthening Problem-Solving, Reasoning, and Expression Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of middle school mathematics concepts, 5+ years of teaching experience, understanding of language use in educational contexts (explanation, questioning, feedback, text analysis), and ability to interpret mathematical symbols and diagrams
context.additional_context: Instructional competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers. Weekend intensive training program for working professionals. Replicates actual classroom environments via smartphone-based VR simulations for student-centered teaching method training. Emphasizes linguistic expression of mathematical concepts (terminology, symbols, diagram interpretation, argument construction). Includes activities to improve learners' reading comprehension and expressive skills.

learning_goals: Propose integrating language learning elements (terminology definition, concept explanation, text analysis) into student-centered math textbook design principles (problem-solving, reasoning, representation).
Develop ≥2 problem-solving activities (constructed-response questions, graphic organizers, concept mapping) considering students’ prior knowledge (basic math concepts and vocabulary levels).

Learners collaborate with ≥3 peers in a VR simulation (e.g., ENGAGE platform) to complete language tasks (terminology explanation, diagram interpretation, argument construction), provide ≥3 structured peer feedbacks (praise-improvement-suggestion format), and design ≥2 scaffolded support stages (concept explanation → application problems).

Create a rubric evaluating the balance between traditional instruction and student-centered approaches, including math concept understanding, linguistic expression, collaboration, and text interpretation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
